6.2. Signing Keys¶

class aleph.crypto.keys.SigningKey(seed_hex=None)¶

Implements signing (private) key.

Parameters

seed_hex (string) – seed used for instantiating this class; if None a key is generated.

sign(message)¶

Returns signed message.

Parameters

message (bytes) – message to be signed

to_hex()¶

Returns hex representation of the secret. It is used for serialization.

class aleph.crypto.keys.VerifyKey(verify_key)¶

Implements verification (public) key.

Parameters

verify_key (nacl.signing.VerifyKey) – key used to instantiate this class

static from_SigningKey(secret_key)¶

A factory generating object of this class from secret_key

Parameters

secret_key (SigningKey) – key used to create VerifyKey

Returns

VerifyKey object

static from_hex(verify_key_hex)¶

A vactory generating object of this class from hex representation

Parameters

verify_key_hex (string) – hex representation of VerifyKey

Returns

VerifyKey object

to_hex()¶

Returns hex representation of this object. It is used for serialization.

verify_signature(signature, message)¶

Verifies signature of the message.

Parameters

  • signature (bytes) – signature to verify

  • message (bytes) – message that was supposedly signed

Returns

True if signature is correct, False otherwise
